name: Hampton Inn Washington, DC - Convention Center

reviews.text: I chose this hotel because of the high rating on tripadvisor.com, and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, parking was quick and easy (albeit $25/day), and the room was in excellent condition. We also had a surprise view of the Washington Monument from our 5th floor window.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: The breakfast did have hot items everyday, but I've seen better hotel breakfasts at Fairfield Inn. I missed the oversized waffles you see at other hotels.
reviews.title: Great Place
Great Place To Stay
reviews.text: As far as negatives go, the indoor pool was freezing, and about as small as possible while still calling it a pool. Picture two hot tubs stuck together, that's about the size. Still, my 7 year old was happy with it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only other negative was the other hotel guests. There were a large number of what I believe were urban high school students also staying at the hotel. We dealt with urine in the elevator, smoking weed in the hallway, and other obnoxious behavior like blocking the elevator doors just for fun. As annoying and sometimes scary as this sounds, the hotel staff were very responsive (security always arrived immediately). We also saw a group of them outside with police talking to them. The only disappointment I felt was that we experienced the same problems every day. I would have thought these individuals would have been kicked out of the hotel, but they were there for at least the four days we were there.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: This is probably one of the cheapest 'nice' hotels you are going to find in the area. It is located outside of China Town - so the area is a bit sketcy. We walked back to the hotel late several nights - and there were a few questionable characters out - but they kept to themselves. We didn't have any problems.
reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise!
Great stay - just be prepared to pay for required valet parking $25.00 a day!
reviews.text: That was just one thing that caught me off guard - the lack of a parking lot, requiring me to unknowingly spend more than I had planned. Luckily it was only for a few days. Chalk one up for not reading the fine print (if there were). I should have assumed due to the location that parking would be scarce, right in Chinatown. We stayed there from June 6-9. The rooms were indeed nice for $239 a night price tag Wed and Thur night. Friday night went down to $139. Beds were queen size, plush with lots of pillows. AIr conditioning was great- I really needed that. Large room, large bathroom with marble counter.The view overlooked Chinatown. The people were friendly, the complimentary breakfast was excellent with hot eggs and sausage. Customer service was good. I called in for toiletries and they promptly brought it up. Location was everything. 2 blocks from the D.C. Chinatown Metro station and Chinatown itself, with lots of shops and restaurants. Go eat at Tony Cheng's Seafood Restaurant, best in D.C. and de-lish. I recommend the salted fish and diced chicken fried rice. Doesn't sound good but just try it! A staple of Cantonese cuisine. We couldn't ask for a better location. Just know that it won't be cheap, but hey this is the northeast and nothing is cheap. All in all, one of the best places you could stay at in D.C. It would be 5 stars if not for the unexpected lack of parking spot/valet price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the nicest Hampton Inn that I have ever stayed in. The rooms had an city trendy feel to them, large rooms for a "city" hotel. Very comfortable beds! Very clean. Large bathroom with granite counter tops, nice toiletries, laptop desk., nice touch. I was pleasantly surprized. I was extremely impressed with the hotel and room...can not go wrong, especially when paying top dollar in this very expensive city.
reviews.title: Not your Typical Hampton Inn...

reviews.text: Entire hotel was wireless....free access, the front desk gives you the code to wireless system. I actually had decent speed , no troubling accessing their network.
reviews.title: Again, another great Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Breakfast was more than a typical continetal. They had eggs, waffles, sausage, cinnimon biskets, plus the usual yogurts, breads, begals, ect. Not bad!
reviews.title: Great Location and Value

reviews.text: My only complainant was that my room was not ready upon check in and I had to wait 40 minutes. This was over Memorial Day weekend, so the hotel was extremely busy, I will cut them a break.
reviews.title: Loved the convience

likes.liked: — THe comfortable bedding and the convient breckfast.
likes.disliked: — It would have been nice to have a restaurant on site.

reviews.text: We were three families staying at three different rooms on the ninth floor. We never found anything worth complaining. Perhaps one could mention that the AC made the breakfast area rather cold, but I was OK with that. Having coffee and tea waiting all day after returning from sightseeing was wonderful. I appreciated the fresh fruits every morning. Hotel location was flawless, close to two circular lines buses. They have two computers available for use if you do not have your own, but there might be cues for those and sometimes they work slow. It was however not an issue for us.
reviews.title: without any flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As said we have no complaints and this hotel is recommended very highly.
reviews.title: Loved This Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending hours looking for a reasonably priced hotel in our nation's capitol, I came upon this gem! After reading the reviews I booked 2 nights for my husband and I. It was rainy the first day of touring, so we added another night with no problem. There was a small refrigerator in the room and a safe for valuables. The staff was superb, very professional and helpful. The hot breakfast was out of this world. We ate a big breakfast before starting out, skipped lunch and then splurged on dinner. The bus goes right by the hotel, so we took it to the mall and back. We did make sure we were back before dark, though. No special reason, but we are from a small town in the midwest and did not know what to expect. The valet parking was worth it to us. Oh, and there were always freshly baked cookies when we came back to the hotel in the afternoon for a rest or change. The beds were very comfortable to us. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and if I am ever back to WDC, I will stay here!
reviews.title: would stay again

reviews.text: The hotel sits near Chinatown, 3 blocks from a Metro station so getting around is easy. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Parking on the street was hard to find but the hotel has valet parking , (you need to plan on the $25 per day charge for that). Staff was pleasant. Didnt try the hot breakfast but from the number of people that were it must have been pretty good!
reviews.title: Recommending hotel to everyone

likes.liked: — Tossup between free breakfast and the beds
likes.disliked: — Convenient location, but a bit scary at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and two kids. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews here, and we could not have chosen any better. Having just spent 2 uncomfortable nights in a hotel in another city, I was very impressed by this hotel. We arrived at 12:00 and were able to check right in. We barely had time to kick our shoes off before we received a call from the front desk to be sure everything was fine with our room...Which is was. The entire staff, from CC the bellhop to the people working the breakfast, were always pleasant and asking if there was anything we needed. And my son loved the cookies and iced tea at the front desk nightly. As others have mentioned, though, I was a bit nervous walking back to the hotel at 11:00 pm, but we just kept to ourselves as did the locals, and everything was fine. Overall, a really great stay.
reviews.title: We loved this choice!

likes.liked: — CLEAN. Food choices were good. Great view.
likes.disliked: — Check in needs some tweaking-a little more care.

reviews.title: Still dreaming of the Hampton Inn Convention Center
reviews.text: It has been over a month since I had the pleasure of staying at this Hampton Inn. From the start the hotel staff far exceeded my expectations with their courtesy, helpfulness, and with appropriate negotiation their willingness to meet my requirements. Despite its location at the busy corner of Mass Ave and 6th St NW I found my room to be quiet. I actually recommend a room on the corner for the city views. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. It was particularly cold while I was there and I found the room temperature comfortable and easy to control. The lobby was an inviting place to partake of the tasty breakfasts. The neighborhood around the convention center is a bit desolate but cabs are plentiful and the Metro is a five minute walk toward Chinatown.

description: This 13 story hotel offers 228 rooms/suites complemented by public facilities which include a newly renovated lobby and breakfast area, a new bar, as well as a business center, guest laundry facility, suite shop, fitness center, meeting rooms, indoor pool with spa and valet parking garage. Each guestroom is finely appointed in a contemporary design with upscale touches.
